sentences: John Davie Burgess  (11 March 1934 â€“ 29 June 2005) was an eminent Scottish bagpipe player.
He initially intended to pursue piping as a hobby, and pursue a career training horses, but he went on a tour of Canada and the United States with Willie Ross in 1952.
Burgess was persuaded by Brigadier Alistair MacLean at the Castle to join the Queen's Own Cameron Highlanders as a piper, and spent three years there, reaching the rank of corporal.
He died on 29 June 2005, and was survived by his wife Sheila and their son, John, and daughter, Margaret.
